title: Tailwind CSS
description: Utility-first CSS framework - responsive design, customization, components, and best practices

questions.question: What is the philosophy behind Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: Tailwind CSS follows a utility-first approach, providing low-level utility classes to build custom designs.

questions.question: How do you apply responsive styles in Tailwind?
options: Use breakpoint prefixes like md:, lg:
questions.explanation: Tailwind uses breakpoint prefixes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:, 2xl:) to apply styles at different screen sizes.

questions.question: What does the @apply directive do?
options: Extracts utility classes into custom CSS
questions.explanation: @apply directive allows you to extract utility classes into custom CSS classes, useful for component styles.

questions.question: Which file is used to customize Tailwind's default configuration?
questions.explanation: tailwind.config.js is used to customize Tailwind's default theme, add plugins, and configure other settings.

questions.question: What does the 'purge' option do in Tailwind config?
questions.explanation: The purge option (now called 'content') removes unused CSS classes from the final build, significantly reducing file size.
